4 int main(int argc, char ** argv)
5 {

7  using namespace pinocchio;
8 
9  // const std::string urdf_filename = "/home/isaac/terrain_property_prediction/src/aliengo_wild_visual_navigation/xacro/aliengo.champ.urdf";
10  const std::string urdf_filename = "/home/isaac/terrain_property_prediction/src/aliengo_wild_visual_navigation/xacro/pinnochio_aliengo.champ.urdf";
11  // const std::string urdf_filename = "/home/isaac/pinocchio/models/example-robot-data/robots/ur_description/urdf/ur5_robot.urdf";
12 
13  // Load the urdf model
14  std::cout <<"Urdf path: " << urdf_filename << std::endl;
15  Model model;
16  pinocchio::urdf::buildModel(urdf_filename, pinocchio::JointModelFreeFlyer(), model);
17 
18  std::cout << "model name: " << model.name << std::endl;
19 
20  // Create data required by the algorithms
21  Data data(model);
22 
23  // Sample a random configuration
24  Eigen::VectorXd q = randomConfiguration(model);
25  q[0] = 0.0; q[1] = 0.0; q[2] = 0.0;
26 
27  std::cout << "Joint Dimension: " << model.nq <<std::endl;
28  std::cout << "Velocity Dimension: " << model.nv <<std::endl;
29  std::cout << "q: " << q.transpose() << std::endl;
30 
31  //velocity initialization
32  Eigen::VectorXd q_dot = Eigen::VectorXd::Random(model.nv);
33  q_dot = (q_dot + Eigen::VectorXd::Ones(model.nv))/2; //normalizing between [0, 1]
34  std::cout << "q_dot: " << q_dot.transpose() << std::endl;
35 
36  // Perform the forward kinematics over the kinematic tree
37  pinocchio::computeAllTerms(model, data, q, q_dot);
38 
39  //Mass matrix
40  Eigen::MatrixXd M_ = data.M;
41  // std::cout << "Mass matrix: \n" << M_ << std::endl;
42 
43  //generalized gravity vector
44  Eigen::VectorXd g_ = data.g;
45 
46  //corriollis matrix
47  pinocchio::computeCoriolisMatrix(model, data, q, q_dot);
48  Eigen::MatrixXd C_ = data.C;
49 
50  // std::vector<double> mass_ = data.mass;
51  // std::cout << "mass vector: " << mass_[0] << " size: " << mass_.size() << std::endl;
52 
53  //getting all the available frames
54  // for (auto frame:model.frames)
55  // std::cout << "Name: " << frame.name << " Type: " << frame.type << std::endl;
56 
57  //compute Jacobian
58  //Step1: Define the contact points and gets its frame ID
59  std::vector<std::string> contact_points {"FL_foot_fixed", "FR_foot_fixed", "RL_foot_fixed", "RR_foot_fixed"}; //using suffix fixed here to indicate joint type
60  std::vector<FrameIndex> contactIds;
61 
62  for(auto cp:contact_points){
63  // std::cout << cp << " exists? " << model.existFrame(cp, FIXED_JOINT) << std::endl;
64  contactIds.push_back(model.getFrameId(cp, FIXED_JOINT));
65  // std::cout << contactIds.back() << std::endl;
66  }
67 
68  //Step2: Compute forward kinematics
69  forwardKinematics(model, data, q); //updates joint placement according to current joint configuration
70  updateFramePlacements(model, data);
71 
72  //step3: compute jacobian for each frame
73  std::vector<Data::Matrix6x> allJacobian;
74  for (auto cId:contactIds){
75  Data::Matrix6x J(6, model.nv);
76  J.setZero();
77 
78  computeFrameJacobian(model, data, q, cId, LOCAL_WORLD_ALIGNED, J);
79  allJacobian.push_back(J);
80  }
81 
82  std::cout << "Jacbian shape: \n" << allJacobian[0].rows() << "x" << allJacobian[0].cols()
83  << " vector size: " << allJacobian.size() << std::endl;
84 
85  std::cout << "Jacbian 0: \n" << allJacobian[0] << std::endl;
86  std::cout << "Jacbian 1: \n" << allJacobian[1] << std::endl;
87 
88  Data::Matrix6x FJ(6, model.nv);
89 
90  FJ = computeJointJacobians(model, data, q);
91 
92  std::cout << "Full Jacboian: \n" << FJ << std::endl;
93  // Print out the placement of each joint of the kinematic tree
94  // std::cout << "\nJoint placements:" << std::endl;
95  // for (JointIndex joint_id = 0; joint_id < (JointIndex)model.njoints; ++joint_id)
96  // std::cout << std::setw(24) << std::left << model.names[joint_id] << ": " << std::fixed
97  // << std::setprecision(2) << data.oMi[joint_id].translation().transpose() << std::endl;
98 
99  return 0;
100
